rules: Rule1: If the researcher has writing skills, then the researcher achieves academic success.
Rule2: Provided that the researcher leaves academia, it is not the case that the researcher failed tenure.
Rule3: Whenever the researcher writes a textbook, then if the researcher receives tenure, it follows that the researcher did not fail tenure.
Rule4: Under the condition that the researcher wrote a monograph, then if the researcher receives tenure, the researcher did not fail tenure.
Rule5: If the researcher authored a chapter in a book, then the researcher wrote a textbook.
Rule6: If the researcher edited a volume, then the researcher wrote a monograph.
Rule7: Whenever the researcher contributed to conference proceedings, then the researcher authored a chapter in a book.
Rule8: Either the researcher contributed to conference proceedings or the researcher organized a conference.
Rule9: Provided that the researcher organized a conference, then the researcher edited a volume.
Rule10: If the researcher received an award for excellence, then the researcher achieves academic success.
Rule11: Under the condition that the researcher received an award for innovation, then the researcher achieves academic success.
Rule12: Whenever the researcher plagiarized work, then it is not the case that the researcher produced original work.
Rule13: Provided that the researcher cited sources, then if the researcher plagiarized work, the researcher produced original work.
Rule14: If the researcher referenced properly, then whenever the researcher plagiarized work, it follows that the researcher produced original work.
Rule15: Under the condition that the researcher used a citation tool, then the researcher cited sources.
Rule16: Either the researcher used a citation tool or the researcher followed a style guide.
Rule17: Whenever the researcher followed a style guide, then the researcher checked references.
Rule18: Provided that the researcher checked references, then the researcher referenced properly.
Rule19: Under the condition that the researcher submitted a paper to a journal, then if the researcher does not have writing skills, the researcher has analysis skills.
Rule20: Either the researcher engaged in international collaboration or if the researcher was demoted, then the researcher was promoted.
Rule21: The researcher engaged in domestic collaboration or it is not the case that the researcher engaged in international collaboration.
Rule22: If the researcher participated in a research seminar in the department, then the researcher was an invited speaker.
Rule23: Under the condition that the researcher presented at a conference, then it is not the case that the researcher attended a workshop.

Rule24: If the committee conducted a research evaluation of the researcher, then if it is not the case that the absence of a keynote presentation or the researcher not being an invited speaker leads to the researcher presenting at a conference, it follows that the researcher published findings.
Rule25: Whenever the researcher completed a research project, then the researcher submitted a paper to a journal.
Rule26: Provided that the researcher demonstrated teaching excellence, then the researcher did not fail tenure.
Rule27: If the researcher demonstrated research excellence, then it is not the case that the researcher failed tenure.
Rule28: The researcher made a service contribution or either the researcher demonstrated teaching excellence or the researcher demonstrated research excellence.
Rule29: Either the researcher performed administrative duties or the researcher did not make a service contribution.
Rule30: Under the condition that the researcher engaged in departmental service, then it is not the case that the researcher performed administrative duties.
Rule31: The researcher served on a university committee or the researcher did not fail tenure.
Rule32: Either the researcher was part of the faculty senate or the researcher did not serve on a university committee.
Rule33: If the researcher contributed to curriculum development, then the researcher was not part of the faculty senate.
Rule34: Whenever the researcher was a program director, then the researcher was not part of the faculty senate.
Rule35: Provided that the researcher created a course, then the researcher contributed to curriculum development.
Rule36: Under the condition that the researcher designed a syllabus, then the researcher was a program director.
Rule37: If the researcher implemented teaching innovation, then either the researcher created a course or the researcher designed a syllabus.
Rule38: If the researcher received positive student evaluations, then the researcher received negative student evaluations.
Rule39: Either the researcher received positive student evaluations or if the researcher underwent pedagogical training, then the researcher implemented teaching innovation.
Rule40: Provided that the researcher wrote grants, then the researcher did not fail tenure.
Rule41: Either the researcher wrote grants or the researcher applied for a fellowship.
Rule42: Under the condition that the researcher applied for a fellowship, then the researcher held a postdoctoral position.
Rule43: Whenever the researcher held a postdoctoral position, then the researcher was a visiting scholar.
Rule44: If the researcher was a visiting scholar, then the researcher did not fail tenure.
Rule45: Under the condition that the researcher attended an international conference, then the researcher conducted a research visit abroad.
Rule46: Whenever the researcher attended a regional meeting, then the researcher attended a local symposium.
Rule47: Either the researcher attended a regional meeting or the researcher attended a national conference.

Rule48: Provided that the researcher achieved career advancement, then if it is not the case that the absence of a tenure decision by the committee regarding the researcher leads to the absence of academic success resulting in the researcher passing the tenure review, it follows that the researcher was promoted.
Rule49: Under the condition that the department recommended the researcher, then the researcher achieved career advancement.
Rule50: Either the department recommended the researcher or the dean approved the researcher.
Rule51: The provost reviewed the researcher or if the dean approved the researcher, then the researcher achieved career advancement.

Rule52: Whenever the researcher conducted an experiment in a study, then if it is not the case that the absence of completing a research project leads to the researcher receiving funding from a grant, it follows that the researcher published a paper in a journal.

Rule53: If a tenure committee was formed for the researcher, then either a peer evaluation was conducted for the researcher or either an external review was conducted for the researcher or if the absence of president approval or the provost not reviewing the researcher leads to the board not making a decision regarding the researcher.
Rule54: Either a tenure committee was formed for the researcher or a promotion committee was formed for the researcher.

Rule55: Provided that a promotion committee was formed for the researcher, then either a peer evaluation was conducted for the researcher or either an external review was conducted for the researcher or if the absence of president approval or the provost not reviewing the researcher leads to the board not making a decision regarding the researcher.
Rule56: Either the researcher received tenure or the researcher left academia.
Rule57: If it is not the case that the researcher received an award for excellence or the researcher received an award for innovation, then the researcher plagiarized work.

Rule58: Provided that it is not the case that the tenure decision made by the committee regarding the researcher leads to the absence of academic success resulting in the researcher passing the tenure review, then the researcher was demoted.
Rule59: Under the condition that it is not the case that the researcher gave a keynote presentation or the researcher was not an invited speaker, then the researcher attended a workshop.

Rule60: Provided that it is not the case that attending a national conference leads to either attending a domestic conference or if the researcher engaged in international collaboration, then the researcher attended an international conference, then the researcher attended an international symposium.

Rule61: Under the condition that it is not the case that attending a national conference leads to either attending a domestic conference or if the researcher engaged in international collaboration, then the researcher attended an international conference, then the researcher did not attend an international symposium.
Rule62: If it is not the case that the president approved the researcher or the provost did not review the researcher, then the board made a decision regarding the researcher.
Rule63: Provided that the researcher does not have writing skills, then the researcher participated in a research seminar in the department.
Rule64: If the researcher does not have writing skills, then it is not the case that the researcher has analysis skills.
Rule65: If the researcher does not achieve academic success, then the researcher failed tenure.
facts: Fact1: The committee made a tenure decision regarding the researcher.
Fact2: The committee conducted a research evaluation of the researcher.
Fact3: The researcher engaged in departmental service.
Fact4: The researcher underwent pedagogical training.
Fact5: The researcher conducted an experiment in a study.
Fact6: It is not the case that the researcher passed the tenure review.
Fact7: It is not the case that the researcher failed the tenure review.
Fact8: It is not the case that the researcher was promoted.
Fact9: It is not the case that the researcher engaged in domestic collaboration.
Fact10: It is not the case that the researcher gave a keynote presentation.
Fact11: It is not the case that the researcher published findings.
Fact12: It is not the case that the researcher received funding from a grant.
Fact13: It is not the case that the researcher received negative student evaluations.
Fact14: It is not the case that the researcher conducted a research visit abroad.
Fact15: It is not the case that the researcher published a paper in a journal.
Fact16: It is not the case that the researcher attended a domestic conference.
Fact17: It is not the case that the researcher attended a local symposium.
Fact18: It is not the case that the president approved the researcher.
Fact19: It is not the case that an external review was conducted for the researcher.
Fact20: It is not the case that a peer evaluation was conducted for the researcher.
